DOC.brief_summary: The COPD Research Registry is a confidential database of individuals diagnosed with COPD or at risk of developing COPD. The Registry was established in 2007 by the COPD Foundation with the purpose of providing a mechanism for researchers to boost enrollment in clinical trials and other research studies. The COPD Foundation is working with National Jewish Health in Denver, Colorado to serve as the Registry's Data Coordinating Center and to ensure strictest confidentiality of participant information.
DOC.criteria: Individuals over the age of 18 who have COPD or may be considered to be at increased risk for development of COPD. Individuals under the age of 18
